Description: Limestone ostracon: on the recto five lines written in red of a text recording a court case concerning grain owned by the late workman Sa-Mut. On the verso seven incomplete lines written in red of an administrative text containing a list of sacks of grain given to (or by) several workmen.
Cultures/periods: New Kingdom (Late 19th Dynasty recto: year 9 Merneptah)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: K.Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' VII (Oxford, 1989), 232; A.G.McDowell, 'Village Life in Ancient Egypt' (Oxford, 1999), p.181, no.137.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136407) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136407)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Robert Curzon, 14th Baron Zouche
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Robert Curzon, 14th Baron Zouche
